languages.text: "Неважных людей. Простолюдинов. Обреченных". {n}Усыпальник брезгливо стряхивает с рук воображаемые капли крови.{/n} "Почтенный Леттард мыслил так — есть ли обреченному прокаженному разница, терзает его болезнь или нож? Стоит ли рецепт лекарства для достойных офицеров жизней нескольких десятков простолюдинов, ставших подопытными? Он учился и изобрел множество бальзамов, противоядий и методов лечения, спасших тысячи жизней".

traits.locale_text: "Неважных людей. Простолюдинов. Обреченных". {n}Усыпальник брезгливо стряхивает с рук воображаемые капли крови.{/n} "Есть ли обреченному прокаженному разница, терзает его болезнь или нож? Стоит ли рецепт лекарства для достойных офицеров жизней нескольких десятков простолюдинов, ставших подопытными? Я учился и изобрел множество бальзамов, противоядий и методов лечения, спасших тысячи жизней".

languages.text: "Unimportant people. Common people. Doomed people." {n}The Requiescator shakes drops of imaginary blood from his hands with disgust.{/n} "This was the esteemed Lettard's way of thinking: does a doomed leper care whether the disease or the knife is causing them pain? Is the formula for a medicine that would cure distinguished officers not worth the lives of a few dozen commoners turned test subjects? With the knowledge he gained, he invented a multitude of balms, antidotes, and treatment methods that went on to save thousands of lives."
languages.original_text: "Неважных людей. Простолюдинов. Обреченных". {n}Усыпальник брезгливо стряхивает с рук воображаемые капли крови.{/n} "Почтенный Леттард мыслил так — есть ли обреченному прокаженному разница, терзает его болезнь или нож? Стоит ли рецепт лекарства для достойных офицеров жизней нескольких десятков простолюдинов, ставших подопытными? Он учился и изобрел множество бальзамов, противоядий и методов лечения, спасших тысячи жизней".

Doomed people." {n}The Requiescator shakes drops of imaginary blood from his hands with disgust.{/n} "This was the esteemed Lettard's way of thinking: does a doomed leper care whether the disease or the knife is causing them pain? Is the formula for a medicine that would cure distinguished officers not worth the lives of a few dozen commoners turned test subjects? "Unimportant people. Common people. Is the formula for a medicine that would cure distinguished officers not worth the lives of a few dozen commoners turned test subjects? As I learned, I invented a multitude of balms, antidotes, and treatment methods that went on to save thousands of lives."

languages.text: « Les gens sans importance. Les gens ordinaires. Les gens condamnés. » {n}D'un air dégoûté, le requiescator secoue ses mains pour les débarrasser de gouttes de sang imaginaires.{/n} « Telle était la façon de penser de l'honorable Lettard : un lépreux condamné se soucie-t-il de ce qui le fait le plus souffrir entre la maladie et le couteau ? La formule d'un médicament qui permettrait de guérir des officiers de haut rang ne vaut-elle pas la vie de quelques dizaines de cobayes choisis parmi la plèbe ? Grâce à toutes les connaissances qu'il a acquises, il a inventé quantité de baumes, d'antidotes et de traitements qui ont permis de sauver des milliers de vies. »
languages.original_text: "Unimportant people. Common people. Doomed people." {n}The Requiescator shakes drops of imaginary blood from his hands with disgust.{/n} "This was the esteemed Lettard's way of thinking: does a doomed leper care whether the disease or the knife is causing them pain? Is the formula for a medicine that would cure distinguished officers not worth the lives of a few dozen commoners turned test subjects? With the knowledge he gained, he invented a multitude of balms, antidotes, and treatment methods that went on to save thousands of lives."

traits.locale_text: « Les gens sans importance. Les gens ordinaires. Les gens condamnés. » {n}D'un air dégoûté, le requiescator secoue ses mains pour les débarrasser de gouttes de sang imaginaires.{/n} « Telle était la façon de penser de l'honorable Lettard : un lépreux condamné se soucie-t-il de ce qui le fait le plus souffrir entre la maladie et le couteau ? La formule d'un médicament qui permettrait de guérir des officiers de haut rang ne vaut-elle pas la vie de quelques dizaines de cobayes choisis parmi la plèbe ? Grâce à toutes les connaissances qu'il a acquises, il a inventé quantité de baumes, d'antidotes et de traitements qui ont permis de sauver des milliers de vies. »

languages.text: «Gente irrelevante. Corriente. Condenada». {n}El requiescator se sacude sangre imaginaria de las manos, asqueado.{/n} «El venerable Lettard pensaba de la siguiente manera: ¿qué le importa a un leproso condenado si el dolor es fruto de la enfermedad o del bisturí? ¿Acaso la fórmula de un medicamento que salvará a oficiales de gran valor no merece la vida de unos cuantos plebeyos convertidos en sujetos de pruebas? Con el saber que obtuvo, inventó toda clase de bálsamos, antídotos y tratamientos con los que se han salvado millares de vidas».
languages.original_text: "Unimportant people. Common people. Doomed people." {n}The Requiescator shakes drops of imaginary blood from his hands with disgust.{/n} "This was the esteemed Lettard's way of thinking: does a doomed leper care whether the disease or the knife is causing them pain? Is the formula for a medicine that would cure distinguished officers not worth the lives of a few dozen commoners turned test subjects? With the knowledge he gained, he invented a multitude of balms, antidotes, and treatment methods that went on to save thousands of lives."

traits.locale_text: «Gente irrelevante. Corriente. Condenada». {n}El requiescator se sacude sangre imaginaria de las manos, asqueado.{/n} «El venerable Lettard pensaba de la siguiente manera: ¿qué le importa a un leproso condenado si el dolor es fruto de la enfermedad o del bisturí? ¿Acaso la fórmula de un medicamento que salvará a oficiales de gran valor no merece la vida de unos cuantos plebeyos convertidos en sujetos de pruebas? Con el saber que obtuvo, inventó toda clase de bálsamos, antídotos y tratamientos con los que se han salvado millares de vidas».

languages.text: 「取るに足らない者達。平民。絶望的な人間達」{n}鎮魂師は手についた想像の血のしずくを振り払う。{/n}「これが名誉あるレタードの考え方です。運の尽きたつまはじき者は、その痛みが病のせいか刃のせいか気にするでしょうか？優秀な士官を治療するために開発した薬は、被験者となった数十人の平民の命を取るまでもなかった物なのでしょうか？彼はこの知識で、多くの鎮静剤、解毒剤、治療法を生み出し、そのおかげで何千人もの命が救われたのです」
languages.original_text: "Unimportant people. Common people. Doomed people." {n}The Requiescator shakes drops of imaginary blood from his hands with disgust.{/n} "This was the esteemed Lettard's way of thinking: does a doomed leper care whether the disease or the knife is causing them pain? Is the formula for a medicine that would cure distinguished officers not worth the lives of a few dozen commoners turned test subjects? With the knowledge he gained, he invented a multitude of balms, antidotes, and treatment methods that went on to save thousands of lives."

traits.locale_text: 「取るに足らない者達。平民。絶望的な人間達」{n}鎮魂師は手についた想像の血のしずくを振り払う。{/n}「これが名誉あるレタードの考え方です。運の尽きたつまはじき者は、その痛みが病のせいか刃のせいか気にするでしょうか？優秀な士官を治療するために開発した薬は、被験者となった数十人の平民の命を取るまでもなかった物なのでしょうか？彼はこの知識で、多くの鎮静剤、解毒剤、治療法を生み出し、そのおかげで何千人もの命が救われたのです」

languages.text: “不重要的人，普通人，难逃一死的人。”{n}安魂师厌恶地甩着手上不存在的鲜血。{/n}“尊敬的莱塔德正是这么想的——如果一个麻风病人注定难逃一死，那他真的会在乎他的痛苦是源自病症，还是源自手术刀吗？如果在几十名普通船员身上进行实验，研发出来的药物可以治好重要军官的病症，这难道不值得吗？凭借他得到的知识，他发明了各种各样的药膏、解毒剂与疗法，挽救了成千上万人的性命。”
languages.original_text: "Unimportant people. Common people. Doomed people." {n}The Requiescator shakes drops of imaginary blood from his hands with disgust.{/n} "This was the esteemed Lettard's way of thinking: does a doomed leper care whether the disease or the knife is causing them pain? Is the formula for a medicine that would cure distinguished officers not worth the lives of a few dozen commoners turned test subjects? With the knowledge he gained, he invented a multitude of balms, antidotes, and treatment methods that went on to save thousands of lives."

traits.locale_text: “不重要的人，普通人，难逃一死的人。”{n}安魂师厌恶地甩着手上不存在的鲜血。{/n}“尊敬的莱塔德正是这么想的——如果一个麻风病人注定难逃一死，那他真的会在乎他的痛苦是源自病症，还是源自手术刀吗？如果在几十名普通船员身上进行实验，研发出来的药物可以治好重要军官的病症，这难道不值得吗？凭借他得到的知识，他发明了各种各样的药膏、解毒剂与疗法，挽救了成千上万人的性命。”

languages.text: Unbedeutende Leute. Gewöhnliche Leute. Verlorene Leute. {n}Der Requiescator schüttelt angewidert imaginäres Blut von seinen Händen.{/n} "Das war die Denkweise des geschätzten Lettard: Kümmert es einen todgeweihten Leprakranken, ob ihm die Krankheit oder das Messer Schmerzen bereitet? Ist die Formel für eine Arznei, die verdiente Offiziere heilt, nicht das Leben einiger Dutzend Normalbürger wert, die zu Testsubjekten gemacht wurden? Mit dem Wissen, das er erlangte, hat er zahlreiche Salben, Gegenmittel und Behandlungsmethoden erfunden, die Tausende von Leben gerettet haben."
languages.original_text: "Unimportant people. Common people. Doomed people." {n}The Requiescator shakes drops of imaginary blood from his hands with disgust.{/n} "This was the esteemed Lettard's way of thinking: does a doomed leper care whether the disease or the knife is causing them pain? Is the formula for a medicine that would cure distinguished officers not worth the lives of a few dozen commoners turned test subjects? With the knowledge he gained, he invented a multitude of balms, antidotes, and treatment methods that went on to save thousands of lives."

traits.locale_text: Unbedeutende Leute. Gewöhnliche Leute. Verlorene Leute. {n}Der Requiescator schüttelt angewidert imaginäres Blut von seinen Händen.{/n} "Das war die Denkweise des geschätzten Lettard: Kümmert es einen todgeweihten Leprakranken, ob ihm die Krankheit oder das Messer Schmerzen bereitet? Ist die Formel für eine Arznei, die verdiente Offiziere heilt, nicht das Leben einiger Dutzend Normalbürger wert, die zu Testsubjekten gemacht wurden? Mit dem Wissen, das er erlangte, hat er zahlreiche Salben, Gegenmittel und Behandlungsmethoden erfunden, die Tausende von Leben gerettet haben."

languages.text: "Önemsiz, sıradan ve ölüme mahkûm kimselere." {n}Ağıtgetiren, iğrentiyle elini sallayarak hayalî kan damlalarını akıtıyor.{/n} "Muhterem Lettard'ın düşünme şekli şu şekildeydi: Ölüme mahkûm olmuş cüzzamlı bir kimse, hastalığın ya da bıçağın kendisine verdiği acıyı umursar mı? Seçkin subayları iyileştirecek bir ilacın formülü, onlarca sıradan yurttaşı denek olarak kullanmaya değmez mi? Rahmetli, kazandığı bilgiyle envaiçeşit merhem, panzehir ve iyileştirme yöntemi geliştirdi. Bu sayede binlerce canı kurtarmayı başardı."
languages.original_text: "Unimportant people. Common people. Doomed people." {n}The Requiescator shakes drops of imaginary blood from his hands with disgust.{/n} "This was the esteemed Lettard's way of thinking: does a doomed leper care whether the disease or the knife is causing them pain? Is the formula for a medicine that would cure distinguished officers not worth the lives of a few dozen commoners turned test subjects? With the knowledge he gained, he invented a multitude of balms, antidotes, and treatment methods that went on to save thousands of lives."
